comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: boards.ancestry.com/surnames.bates/758/mb.ashx could refer to him: I am researching a Thomas F. Bates, born about 1826. He lived in Matagorda, Texas in 1861 and served in Company D, 6th Texas Infantry during the Civil War. I believe he and his wife died in a Yellow fever epidemic in Sept-Nov 1862. www.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~txmatago/conf_co_d_pvt_1.htm has more details of service and sickness chronology.
